comments:
1) CVS Checkout the tag FREEZE_FOR_PR-2003-01-17 of the 4 plugins in the EDT 
project at http://sourceforge.net/projects/edt/ 
	-ca.yourku.cs.edt.core
	-ca.yourku.cs.edt.ue
	-ca.yourku.cs.edt.debug.core
	-ca.yourku.cs.edt.debug.ui

2) Click Run->Run As->Runtime Workbench

3) On the new Eclipse that opens, open perspective "Eiffel"

4) Go to Run->Run...

5) Select the Eiffel launch configuration type, click New

6) A subitem is created and the pane on the right is populated with the tabs. 
This is the expected correct behavior. So far so good. Delete this new 
configuration, close, exit the runtime workbench, go back to the development 
workbench.


7) Right-click on plugin.xml of ca.yourku.cs.edt.core, choose "Create Plug-in 
JARs", wait for its completion

8) Right-click on the newly generated build.xml, choose "Run Ant". Go to the 
TARGETS tab, uncheck "Run default target", remove all build target entries 
except "zip.plugin". Click "Run" 

9) Right-click on the plugin, click refresh, see the new zip file (long file 
name, with version and all) with the plugin ready for deployment.

10) Repeat steps 7..9 for all plugins listed in item 1

11) Install the zips above in a separate "Eclipse for testing" install, 
unzipping under c:\eclipse4testing\plugins (assuming your "Eclipse for testing" 
is at c:\eclipse4testing)

12) Launch this new "Eclipse for testing"

13) Repeat steps 3..6 in this "Eclipse for testing". You will see that a 
subitem of the launch configuration type is created but the dialog is not 
populated with the tabs on the right

14) Check your .log. It will have something like this:

As a developer I was expecting this to work or fail on both "runtime workbench" 
and "development workbench". As it is I believe my plugins work but I can't 
deply them because the packaging produces unusable zips.

Also, the trace is not very informative. Where exactly is the class 
initialization problem of IEiffelLaunchConfigurationConstants happening, and 
why exactly ?
Moving to JDT Debug for comment.
Moving to PDE (owner of Runtime workbench launch config).

If you change plugin.xml in all 4 plugins to look like this

   <runtime>
      <library name="...">
	      <export name="*"/>
      </library>
   </runtime>  

Then the Run As->Runtime Workbench and a real deployment runtime will work the 
same, no exception. (Thanks Eduardo pereira !!)

So, the problem seems to be that when running as Run As->Runtime Workbench all 
features are exported "for free", but not so when in the "real scenario". This 
is misleading, both scenarios should be the same so that the developper knows 
what to expect from the real deployment.

--marcio
